intro: Varronia neowediana, commonly known as the Neowedian varronia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in tropical regions of countries like Mexico and Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests or disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
